Sure, here is the answer to the question: 
Carolus Linnaeus was a 18th-century Swedish botanist, zoologist, and taxonomist who laid the groundwork for the modern system of binomial nomenclature. He is known as the father of modern taxonomy and is often referred to as one of the most influential naturalists of all time.
